author: Jim Kiest
title: Adele is on the line
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 This CD cover image released by Columbia Records shows "25," the latest release by Adele. The album will be released on Nov. 20. (Columbia via AP) This CD cover image released by Columbia Records shows "25," the latest release by Adele. The album will be released on Nov. 20. (Columbia via AP) Photo: Adele25, Associated Press Adele is on the line 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
"Hello, it's me." 
It's a genius move, really. "Hello," Adele's first new single in three years addresses the time and distance that have grown between her and her fans, the gap between "21" and "25," which will finally arrive next month. 
Ostensibly, it's a phone call to an ex-lover, from a million miles and a lifetime away. Adele's fans should feel free to take it personally. She has been gone a long time, and they have been missing her. 
"I was wondering if after all these years you'd like to meet. To go over everything." 
Any reasonable person would be making up excuses, if necessary, to miss that meaning. Adele inspires unreasonable devotion, though, and millions are waiting to take this call 
Musically, "Hello" starts out quiet and melancholy then swells into awesome Adele vocal fireworks. It's an epic drunk dial symphony. 
Like it or not, you and Adele are getting back together.
